Event.name: Have_visitor_over
Event.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Host</fen>, at a location strongly associated with him/herself (such as a place of employment or residence), temporarily hosts a <fen>Visitor</fen> so that the <fen>Visitor</fen> can achieve a goal. The purpose of the visit is often social in nature.
<ex><fex name="Host">We</fex> <t>had</t> <fex name="Visitor">him</fex> <t>over</t> <fex name="Purpose">for tea</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Host
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Host</fen> allows the <fen>Visitor</fen> to enter his/her location (house, office, etc.) for a temporary period so that the Visitor can achieve a goal. The goal is often socially-motivated (e.g., socialization between the <fen>Visitor</fen> and the <fen>Host</fen>).</def-root>

Arg.name: Visitor
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Visitor</fen> is a guest of the <fen>Host</fen> at a location strongly associated with the <fen>Host</fen>.</def-root>

lexUnit.name: have over.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: be host to a visitor at, e.g., one's home.
